action_details.value: {"from_to_rows_to_columns": {"Average Active Sessions": "AAS", "Background CPU Usage Per Sec": "BKGRCPU_PER_SEC", "CPU Usage Per Sec": "CPU_PER_SEC", "DB Block Changes Per Txn ": "DBBLKSCHANGES_PER_SEC", "Executions Per Sec": "EXEC_PER_SEC", "Host CPU Usage Per Sec": "HOST_CPU_PER_SEC", "I/O Megabytes per Second": "IOMBPS", "I/O Requests per Second": "IOPS", "Logical Reads Per Txn": "LOG_READS_PER_TXN", "Logons Per Sec": "LOGONS_PER_SEC",  "Physical Reads Per Sec": "PHY_READS_PER_SEC",  "Physical Writes Per Sec": "PHY_WRITES_PER_SEC", "Redo Generated Per Sec": "REDO_GEN_PER_SEC", "SQL Service Response Time": "SQL_RT", "User Calls Per Sec": "USERCALLS_PER_SEC", "User Transaction Per Sec": "USER_TX_PER_SEC"}, "TARGET_COLUMN": "METRIC_NAME", "TARGET_STATS_COLUMNS": ["PERC90","PERC95"], "INDEX_COLUMNS": ["PKEY", "DBID","INSTANCE_NUMBER","HO"], "store": "BIGQUERY", "filterrows": "YES"}

dataframe_reshape_dbahistsysstat.description: This parameter indicates that CSV for DBAHISTSYSSTAT tablename needs to have its dataframe reshaped.

db_migration-rule00-1.description: Creating a new column to standardize the column name.

db_migration-rule00.description: Creating a new dataframe out of some columns from DBSUMMARY.

db_migration-rule01.description: This rule adds a new column dataFrames['OPTIMUSCONFIG_NETWORK_TO_GCP'].loc[dataFrames['OPTIMUSCONFIG_NETWORK_TO_GCP']['network_to_gcp'] == transformersParameters['network_to_gcp']]

db_migration-rule02.description: Creating new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.NETWORK_TO_GCP. For now hard coded 1 Gbps

db_migration-rule03.description: Creating new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.NETWORK_TRANSFER_RATE_GBYTESPS. For now hard coded 0.1220703125.

db_migration-rule04.description: Creating new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.NETWORK_TRANSFER_RATE_MBYTESPS. For now hard coded 125.

db_migration-rule05.description: Creating new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.SSD_DISK_WRITE_RATE_GBYTESPS. For now hard coded 0.36.

db_migration-rule06.description: Creating new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.SSD_DISK_WRITE_RATE_MBYTESPS. For now hard coded 360.

db_migration-rule07.description: Creating column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.TIME_TO_BACKUP_TO_DISK_HOUR. This is DATABASE SIZE ALLOCATED / Time to Write to SSD (0.36 gbytes). Converted from seconds to hour.

db_migration-rule08.description: Creating column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.TIME_TO_TRANSFER_BACKUP_OVER_NETWORK_HOUR. This is based on (DATABASE SIZE ALLOCATED * 0.7)/(1 Gbps Network throughput(0.1220 gbytes per sec)) DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.NETWORK_TRANSFER_RATE_GBYTESPS. Then, converted from seconds to hour.

db_migration-rule09.description: Creating a new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.TIME_TO_RESTORE_BACKUP_HOUR. This columns will follow the rule of thumb of taking 2.5 times from backup to disk time.

db_migration-rule10.description: Creating column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.TIME_TO_RESTORE_INCR_7DAY_BKP_HOUR. This column will reflect the time to restore from local disk 7 days worth of redo. We are using time to write to disk as 0.36 gigas per second. Converting it to day.

db_migration-rule11.description: Creating a new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.REQUIRED_DB_DOWNTIME_HOURS. If the technique is RMAN_BACKUP_RESTORE, then, downtime formula is (time to backup the database to disk + time transfer backup of database + time to restore the database) in hours

db_migration-rule12.description: Creating a new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.REQUIRED_DB_DOWNTIME_HOURS. If the technique is EXP_FULL, then, downtime formula is (time to backup the database to disk + time transfer backup of database + time to restore the database) * 1.2 (20%) in hours (for validations)

db_migration-rule13.description: Creating a new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.REQUIRED_DB_DOWNTIME_HOURS. If the technique is XTTS_INCREMENTAL, then, downtime formula is time to restore 7 Day worth of redo for this database (TIME_TO_RESTORE_INCR_7DAY_BKP_HOUR) + 2 hours (for validations)

db_migration-rule14.description: Creating a new column DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.REQUIRED_DB_DOWNTIME_HOURS. If the technique is DATA_GUARD, then, downtime formula is time to restore 1 Day worth of redo for this database (TIME_TO_RESTORE_INCR_7DAY_BKP_HOUR/7). 1 day is usually a lot of out of sync for a Data Guard, but we are considering worse case scenario.

db_migration-rule15.description: Adds a new column to DBMIGRATION_DETAILS.LEVEL_OF_EFFORT_HOURS = 'To Be Developed'

bms_sizing-rule01.description: This rule adds a new column calculating the host cpu consumption using total busy / (busy+idle) * 100

bms_sizing-rule02.description: Create a new dataframe out of joining AWRHISTSYSMETRICHIST_RS(database metrics) and AWRHISTOSSTAT_RS(os metrics)

bms_sizing-rule03.description: This rule adds a new column calculating the database cpu consumption using (cpu_usage_per_sec_perc95 + bkgr_cpu_usage_per_sec_perc95) / (host_cpu_per_sec_perc95 / host_cpu_utilization). First () adds up all CPU consumed in secs in the db. Second () calculates how many secs is 1%. Then, we divide first part by second part.

bms_sizing-rule04.description: This rule adds a new column calculating the database cpu consumption using (num_cpu_cores_perc95 / 100) / * cpudb95_perc.

bms_sizing-rule05.description: This rule adds a new column calculating the database cpu consumption using (num_cpu_cores_perc95 / 100) / * host_cpu_utilization.

bms_sizing-rule06.description: This rule adds a new column calculating the database cpu consumption using (num_cpu_cores_perc95 / 100) / * host_cpu_utilization.

bms_sizing-rule07.description: This rule adds a new column calculating the database cpu consumption using (num_cpu_cores_perc95 / 100) / * host_cpu_utilization.

bms_sizing-rule08.description: This rule adds a new column calculating the necessary storage to meed the requireed IOPs for the database.

bms_sizing-rule09.description: This rule creates a new dataframe out of a selected list of columns from AWRHISTSYSMETRICHIST_RS_AWRHISTOSSTAT_RS dataframe.

bms_sizing-rule10.description: Creating new dataframe out of joining DBSIZING_FACTS and DBSUMMARY.

bms_sizing-rule11.description: Creating new column DBSIZING_FACTS.BMSSTORAGE_TB_DB. This columns checks what would be the storage requirements in BMS. It considers two sources. 1) Database Size Allocated 2) IOPs. Whichever produces the highest storage size in TB will be used. Rounding it up.

bms_sizing-rule12.description: Creating new column DBSIZING_FACTS.BMSMEMORY_GB_DB to reflect DATABASE MEMORY ALLOCATED in Gigabytes PLUS 20% room for grownth. Rounding it up.

bms_sizing-rule13.description: Transforming column DBSIZING_FACTS.PHYSICAL_MEMORY_BYTES_PERC95 from bytes to GigaBytes. Rounding it up.

bms_sizing-rule14.description: Creating dataframe. Getting the MAX CPU Cores Percentil 95% and Memory per environment per hour.

bms_sizing-rule15.description: Final BMS cores DATABASE sizing for Percentil 95%. Round up number. REMOVED 30% room for grownth on 08/19 per discussion with Ashok.

bms_sizing-rule16.description: Final BMS cores HOST sizing for Percentil 95%. Round up number. REMOVED 30% room for grownth on 08/19 per discussion with Ashok.
